metadata.title: CVE-2022-21515 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Options). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.38 and priorand 8.0.29 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows highprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatablecrash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.9 (Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mariadb-10.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
